places.generalDescription: Tenneti Park, nestled along Beach Road in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is a delightful urban oasis that captivates visitors with its breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal. This beautifully landscaped park has undergone significant renovations to restore its charm after Cyclone Hudhud's devastation. Now featuring well-maintained gardens and inviting walkways, it serves as a perfect retreat for leisurely strolls or peaceful picnics amidst nature.

sources.snippet: Tenneti Park is a popular recreational spot located along Vizag- Bheemili road with well-connected road transportation. This is a modern urbanized park with all basic amenities. The park is just five kms away from RK beach and has beautiful seashore beside it.

places.name: Tenneti Park

reviews.text:
A very well-maintained park in Vizag-I planned an early morning visit during my stay in the city.

The atmosphere was pleasant, and the views were stunning. The beach, the stranded Bangladesh ship, and the sunrise created such a calming experience.

It's a peaceful place to spend a quiet morning. I'm not sure if it gets crowded later in the day, especially with kids, but I had a great time there.

I took the stairs down for a closer view of the stranded ship. There were quite a few photoshoots going on near the rocks, with the ship as a backdrop and the sunrise adding a natural effect. üòÅ I also got to see some local fishermen pulling in their nets full of fish.

Overall, it was a good experience, and I would definitely recommend anyone visiting Vizag to plan a morning visit here.

Peaceful park. It is a really good location to chill. It is a very photogenic location with great view points. It is beside kailasagiri. There is a good car parking area on the opposite road.

There are benches available at various places in the park where one can sit and relax. You can go down the stairs to visit the ship.

There is a view point on the way to stairs where you click good photos with beach, mountain and ship as backgrounds.

Visited this place last month. It's a famous reels location. It has a nice park, view points, easy access to the beach and a foreign stranded ship which is being converted into another attraction. Don't just go there for making reels and clicking photos. One should feel the sea breeze on their face and observe the waves. It's an entirely different feeling.

places.generalDescription: Rushikonda Beach, located near Vizag, is a picturesque and popular destination known for its curved shoreline, clear waters, and surrounding hills. It's often referred to as the 'Jewel of the East Coast' due to its pristine beauty. The beach offers various water sports such as diving, jet skiing, windsurfing, and swimming. Visitors can also enjoy the tranquil atmosphere away from city life while taking in the stunning views of rocky shores and distant hills.

sources.snippet: Surrounded by a border of emerald greenery, the virgin beach of Rushikonda with its sparkling blue waters forms a sight that is a treat for the eyes and food for the tired souls. The soft golden sands of the beach complement the beach setting making it one of the most scenic tourist places in Vizag. Rushikonda beach is listed among one of the few beaches in Andhra Pradesh that is maintained by APTDS which is the state‚Äôs tourism development corporation.

places.name: Rushikonda Beach

reviews.text:
In the month of March, I had the opportunity to visit Rushikonda Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, with my close friend Ayush. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable and refreshing experiences of our trip. Known for its natural beauty and clean shoreline, Rushikonda Beach is truly a gem on the east coast.

The beach was lively yet peaceful, with golden sands and clear blue waters creating a stunning view. The gentle waves and cool breeze made it a perfect spot to relax and unwind. We spent a good amount of time walking along the shore, chatting, and soaking in the serene atmosphere.

What made the experience even better was the scenic drive to the beach. Surrounded by lush greenery and coastal roads, the journey itself was quite beautiful. The beach is also a great place for water sports like jet skiing and surfing, which adds excitement for adventure lovers, though we mainly went there to enjoy the peaceful vibe.

Food stalls near the beach served tasty local snacks, allowing us to enjoy a light meal while enjoying the sea view. The beach was clean and well-maintained, which made our visit even more pleasant.

Overall, Rushikonda Beach is a must-visit destination in Vizag for anyone who loves nature, sea views, and a relaxed vibe. It was a memorable experience that I'd highly recommend to others. I would love to visit again someday.

This is the only beach in Vizag where one can do swimming and also do water sports such as jet ski, speed boat and many more. This is also one of the most popular beaches among tourists. The beach is very lively and there are some good photogenic spots as well.

This is one of the best beaches of Vizag. The    sea current is usually gentle here, with a constant watch from the security, warning tourists venturing little inside the sea. A lot of families with kids and friends in groups make the most of this lovely sea coast playing in the serene beaches, enjoying the water rides, taking lovely photos, riding horses, and kids collecting sea shells.
Note that Scuba diving is open only in winters between Sep through Jan. On the other days, one can enjoy speed boats and speed scooter rides.
Note:
This beach does not have a facility  to shower. The facility that AP tourism provides is mostly non- functional; most of the time, there would be no water. So please make your own arrangements. The support staff at this facility are extremely arrogant and rude. Avoid this place.
There would be numerous photographers reaching out to you for snaps. Be very careful dealing with them.
Also, please be aware that the speed boat driver would usually ask for additional money to take you a little more inside the sea - don't encourage this. This is another trick to fool tourists and make more money.

places.generalDescription: Yarada Beach is a serene and picturesque destination in Visakhapatnam, also known as Vizag. Surrounded by scenic cliffs and offering stunning ocean views, this beach provides a peaceful atmosphere for travelers seeking an escape from city life. The untouched sandy shores and clear waters make it an ideal spot for nature and seascape photography. With hills on three sides, the beach boasts isolated surroundings that are perfect for capturing breathtaking shots.

sources.snippet: To reach the beach , you have to cross the eastern ghats and the journey would take you along snaking mountainous road which would make you doubt for a moment if you are in South India or the Himalayas in the North. You can see the Visakhapatnam city slowly becoming smaller and smaller and then you can see the lovely city sprawling across the rocky eastern ghats and the glistening blue waters of the Bay of Bengal. When you reach the beach , be ready to skip a heart beat again as the blue sea , the white sands, coconut groves and the garland of rocks welcome you.

One of the best things about Vizag‚Äôs beaches is that they are a lot cleaner and a lot less crowded than other famous beaches along the Indian coastline, and Yarada beach is no exception.

reviews.text:
Visited Yarada Beach with my friend Ayush during our Vizag trip, and it was an unforgettable experience! The drive to the beach was a bit risky - winding roads and sharp turns made it quite the adventure - but totally worth it for the breathtaking view that awaited us.
We spent a relaxing two hours there, soaking in the natural beauty and sipping on some of the biggest and freshest coconuts we've ever had! ü••‚òÄÔ∏è The beach is clean, peaceful, and offers a perfect escape from the city buzz.
Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind with a scenic backdrop! Just be cautious on those roads. üòâ

Yarada is a beautiful long beach, with coconut grooves and dense hills on one side.
Good for long walks, quality time with family and kids or picnic.
Actual beach front is steep, not recommend for bathing due to safety reasons.
Not much of commercialization, no shacks, no restaurants.
It's painful to see such a beautiful beach surrounding littered with polythenes and bottles.

The drive to reach this beach is fairly decent, with accessible roads and manageable traffic. However, the beach itself is quite disappointing. Cleanliness is severely lacking, and the water quality is poor, making it an unappealing spot for visitors.

Swimming is not allowed, as there are multiple warning signs citing dangerous depths, which further limits the recreational appeal of this place. Overall, it's one of the worst beach experiences I've had.

I sincerely hope the local authorities take action to improve the condition of the beach-both in terms of cleanliness and safety-so it can become a more enjoyable destination in the future.

places.generalDescription: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a popular tourist destination located on the Gangavaram port of Vizag, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city and ocean. The name is derived from the large rock viewpoint that resembles a dolphin's nose shape. This 174-meter-high headland provides stunning vistas of the coastline and lush green hills.

sources.snippet: One of Visakhapatnam‚Äôs most beloved tourist spots, Dolphin‚Äôs Nose, is truly a sight to behold. The name is derived from the shape of the large rock formation itself, which does resemble a dolphin‚Äôs nose in profile when viewed from afar. At an altitude of 174 meters above sea level, you‚Äôll be able to catch fascinating views of the bustling city at one end, and at the other you can watch the serene comings and goings of ships along the coast.

places.name: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse

reviews.text:
It is a must visit place in vizag. The experience is amazing. The view is breathtaking. The timings are restricted from 3PM - 5PM only, so plan accordingly.

It is located towards the south of vizag, roughly 25km from RK beach. The way goes through industrial areas, military areas and a steep ghat road. The ghat road journey can be a little tough with sharp turns, speed breakers, steep road and bumpy patches.

Once you reach the entrance, there is a good parking area and you can buy the entry ticket. From there you need to walk around 200-300m to the main lighthouse. From there you need to climb around 70 normal steps and 10-12 steps in a ladder to reach the top.

The view is just breathtaking and very wholesome. The wind will be strong, so take care of your belongings. And walk slowly as there is less area to roam on the top. Cellphone signals will be weak here.

Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse, perched atop Dolphin's Nose hill (Yarada Hills) in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is an iconic maritime landmark offering breathtaking coastal views and historical significance.

You can come here via public transport which is very less to this place or via private vehicles (recommend).
I went here via scooty which gives an amazing experience.
A few places are available for the public as most of the place is acquired by the Indian Navy.
The place is full of historical and cultural significance.
At main enty a fee of 10 will be collected and vehicle details would be captured.
Timing of this place is very much crucial so be on time that is 3-5pm
You will get an amazing experience with mesmerizing view.
One more thing. However there is a small shop and bathroom but if possible bring your own thing with you.

The Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is one of Vizag's hidden gems and absolutely worth a visit. Perched on a rocky headland, the lighthouse offers a spectacular panoramic view of the coastline and the vast Bay of Bengal. The sweeping sight of the blue waters meeting the rugged shoreline is truly breathtaking and makes the climb worthwhile.

The area around the lighthouse is calm and less crowded, which adds to the charm. It's a great spot for photography, relaxation, or simply soaking in the refreshing sea breeze. The vantage point also gives visitors a unique perspective of Vizag's natural beauty, blending hills, sea, and port views all in one frame. Do take note of the visiting time on the day of your visit. Its 3pm-5pm.
Security is kind of strict in the area for obvious reasons.

For those exploring the city, the Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a must-visit destination to experience the scenic grandeur of the coast

It offers a serene and beautiful environment with easy trekking opportunities on the nearby mountains. The beach features small caves and an abundance of marine life, making it perfect for exploration. While the area may have some plastic waste, the water remains clean and less polluted. Visitors can enjoy stunning views from atop two small hills and indulge in activities like photography or simply relaxing with friends and family.

reviews.text: A little over an hour away from the city, but a very quiet and serene spot with a beautiful sunset. Not too crowded even during the weekends. The roads however could be a little narrow for a 4 wheeler.

"I visited this beach, and it's a must-visit spot for every tourist. It is located quite far from Vizag city, but the stunning views make the trip worthwhile. The highlight of the beach is the two massive rocks, approximately 50 meters high, which people often climb to enjoy the breathtaking view. It's an ideal location for photoshoots.

There's also a nearby village where you can find basic essentials, making it a great spot for picnics and chilling out with friends. One fascinating thing about this beach is that one side has low tides while the other side experiences high tides, making it safe for families to enjoy the calmer side.

I thoroughly enjoyed my time here. The beautiful sunset was mesmerizing, and the surrounding hills added to the charm. However, the roads leading to the beach are narrow, so you need to drive carefully. Overall, it was an amazing experience, and I had a lot of fun!

reviews.text:
"I'm absolutely delighted to give RK Beach a well-deserved 5-star review! This stunning beach has become my go-to spot for relaxation and fun in the sun.

Firstly, the beach's proximity to public transport makes it incredibly easy to get to, even for those without their own vehicles. The convenience factor is a huge plus in my book!

Once you arrive, you'll be spoiled for choice with the vast array of snacks available. From crispy street food to refreshing coconut water, and from spicy local delicacies to sweet treats, there's something for every taste and craving. I was impressed by the variety and quality of the snacks on offer!

The beach itself is beautifully maintained, with clean sand, calm waters, and picturesque views. It's the perfect spot to unwind, take a leisurely stroll, or simply enjoy quality time with family and friends.

I've visited RK Beach multiple times, and each time I'm impressed by its charm and character. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this beach is an absolute must-visit. Five stars isn't enough ‚Äì I'd give it ten stars if I could!

*Pros:* Easily accessible, variety of snacks, well-maintained beach, picturesque views

*Cons:* None!

*Recommendation:* Head to RK Beach for a day of relaxation, fun, and sun. You won't regret it!"
The beach is okay but there are better beaches in the city. The beach road is amazing though, and all the museums are located around here.

I recently visited RK Beach in Vizag with my family, and it was truly an amazing experience! We went there around 9 PM and ended up staying until 1:30 in the morning - that's how beautiful and peaceful the place was. Time just flew by without us even realizing it.

The night view of the beach was simply fantastic. The sound of the sea waves, the cool breeze, and the reflection of the moon on the water created a magical atmosphere. It was a perfect night for relaxation and quality family time. There were many other families there too, enjoying the calm and safe environment.

My kids had a great time playing on the sand and watching the waves. The beach was lively but not too crowded, which made it even more enjoyable. One of the best things was that even at night, there were small stalls available for snacks, tea, and coffee - perfect for keeping warm and refreshed.

Overall, it was a memorable night by the sea. RK Beach is definitely a must-visit spot in Vizag, especially if you want to spend peaceful, happy moments with your loved ones. We're already planning to come back again soon!

reviews.text: Good location for family to spend time in the mornings and evenings. There are steps from the garden to the beach. Great view of the beach, mountains and the city. The abandoned ship is a good attraction.

BEAUTIFUL PLACE BUT WITH LOTS OF SCAMMERS.

This is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy the scenic beauty. However, the experience is often spoiled by scammers posing as photographers who deceive visitors and extract large sums of money. They usually operate in groups, surrounding their targets and even resorting to threats if their demands are not met.

At first, they persistently offer to take photos, claiming that each picture costs only ‚Çπ20. The seemingly reasonable price may make you agree, but this is where the trick begins. They proceed to take numerous photos without your consent and later display them at a rapid pace, allowing you to view each image only once. Once selected, you cannot go back and change your choices. Some photos may be barely visible, yet they are included in the count.

Unknowingly, you might believe you've selected just 5-6 photos, but they claim you have chosen around 40-50. As a result, instead of paying ‚Çπ100-‚Çπ120 as planned, you are suddenly asked to pay ‚Çπ800-‚Çπ1000. If you refuse, they intimidate you and prevent you from leaving.

Visitors should stay cautious of these scammers, and the Visakhapatnam Police and Administration must take action to ensure public safety and protect the reputation of this beautiful destination.

reviews.text: Beautiful beach with a small park up front and a few fast food stalls. Peaceful place and a good open road ride, free of city traffic towards the beach. Photographers at the beach are the most annoying things there. They won't leave you the whole time.

Unlike bustling city beaches, Bheemili offers a quiet and tranquil atmosphere, ideal for relaxation.¬†The beach boasts golden sands and calm waters, making it perfect for enjoying the sea.
There may be limited options for restaurants and hotels in the immediate area, so it's advisable to carry food and water.

Why Bheemli Beach is a Must-Visit:

1. Scenic Drive: The 25-30 km ride from Vishakhapatnam Beach Road to Bheemli is breathtaking, with lush greenery, towering trees, and majestic mountains on one side and the sea on the other.
2. Thrilling Ride: Riding a scooty adds to the thrill of the journey, making it an exhilarating experience.
3. Serene Beach: Bheemli Beach is a peaceful escape, with smaller stones and fewer crowds, making it perfect for relaxation.
4. Natural Beauty: The beach is surrounded by natural beauty, with the sea on one side and mountains on the other, creating a unique and picturesque landscape.
5. Peaceful Atmosphere: The beach is ideal for those seeking a tranquil getaway, away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Overall, Bheemli Beach is a hidden gem near Vishakhapatnam, offering a unique blend of natural beauty, adventure, and relaxation.

reviews.text: Such a beautiful discovery as it is one of the most peaceful, beautiful and non crowded beaches around Vizag. It's clean and heavenly. The fishermen and the fish are at play and the humans are at bay :)

I recently visited Mutyalammapalem Beach, and it's a hidden gem worth exploring, .The beach's pristine beauty and tranquility make it a perfect escape for families. However, it's important to note that I did notice a faint chemical smell in the vicinity, which might be attributed to nearby industrial activities. While it's a minor drawback,

One charming aspect of this beach is the presence of colorful fishing boats, which not only add to the natural beauty but also provide an authentic glimpse into the local fishing community's life.

I recommend visiting during daylight hours when the scenic beauty of the beach shines through, and the smell is less noticeable. Overall, it's a serene spot for a family outing that's not to be missed.

places.generalDescription: Mangamaripeta Beach, situated near Vishakhapatnam, is a culturally and naturally rich destination. The beach boasts a Buddhist complex perched at a considerable height, attracting many visitors. It offers a serene environment to relax and enjoy the rhythmic waves. This popular beach also provides opportunities for water sports and features the stunning Mangamaripeta arch. Additionally, it holds historical significance as it was once a prominent center for Buddhism monks under the Kingdom of Kalingas.

sources.snippet: Another culturally and naturally endowed beach, this one in the vicinity of Vishakhapatnam is surely one of the most magnificent ones. The beach has a Buddhist complex located at a considerable height on the beach, which many visitors come specially to see.
